question: Which is the world's largest filled-aperture (full dish) radio telescope?
explanation: Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST), also known as Tianyan, built by China is the world's largest filled-aperture (full dish) radio telescope. It is also the second-largest single-dish aperture radio telescope after the RATAN 600 of Russia. It achieved its first light (first use of a telescope to take an astronomical image after it has constructed) in 2016.
